articles.title: Bitcoin Staking Layer Core Expands Dual BTC Staking in Asia with Cobo Integration
articles.summary: Core Foundation and Cobo are working together to expand the reach of Core's Dual Staking solution in Asia. Core is Bitcoin's first Proof of Stake layer and the largest Bitcoin DeFi ecosystem. Cobo is a leading provider of digital asset custody and infrastructure. Core's solution allows institutions to maximize Bitcoin yields by staking both Bitcoin and CORE tokens.

articles.title: White House summit showcases Trump's favorable treatment of crypto industry
articles.author: Zac Anderson
articles.summary: Trump signed an executive order promoting digital asset markets shortly after taking office. He followed it with another order creating a Strategic Bitcoin Reserve to store federal holdings of the popular cryptocurrency. Trump also backed legislation providing "regulatory certainty" for crypto after years of tougher treatment by former President Joe Biden's administration.

articles.title: Trial date set for Singaporean Malone Lam, who's accused of stealing US$230 million in crypto
articles.author: Caroline Malone
articles.summary: Malone Lam is accused of stealing and laundering US$230 million worth of cryptocurrency. He will go on trial on Oct 6 in the United States. He is being held in a prison in Virginia. The case has drawn interest in Singapore after news of Lam's lavish spending from the alleged theft.

articles.title: Coinbase CEO: Trump 'breathed life' into crypto industry

articles.summary: President Trump is trying to support the crypto industry. Brian Armstrong is planning to hire a thousand people in response to regulatory clarity. Armstrong stresses the need for bipartisan support to ensure the long-term success of the industry. He believes that this will create a stable regulatory environment and foster further growth and innovation.

FIFA president Gianni Infantino suggested that the football federation is interested in developing the FIFA coin under his presidency. The 2026 FIFA World Cup will be hosted in Canada, Mexico and the United States.

articles.title: White House hosts crypto leaders as Trump moves to deregulate industry

articles.summary: President Donald Trump hosted a summit at the White House on Friday to promote his plans for a government-owned stockpile of digital assets. He wants to build a strategic reserve containing bitcoin. The OCC on Friday rescinded guidance for banks regarding some of their crypto activities. The announcement weighed on the price of bitcoin.

articles.summary: Cryptocurrency investors and executives gathered at the White House for a summit with Donald Trump on Friday. They represent billions in net worth and made more than $11 million in donations to Trump's inaugural committee. Since taking office, the Trump administration has dropped legal action against several leading crypto companies and on Friday hosted a White House meeting that drew alarm from ethics watchdogs.

articles.title: Nucleus dark web marketplace Bitcoin wallets reactivated after nine years
articles.author: Brenda Kanana
articles.summary: Nucleus Marketplace disappeared in April 2016. On 7 March 2025, the wallets associated with it received $77.5 million in Bitcoin and transferred this amount to three new addresses. This is the first time since the platform vanished that funds have been moved. The new addresses involved in the transactions include 1GGe3, which was last active in April last year.

Ben Shapiro, founder of the Daily Wire, this week launched an online petition calling for Trump to pardon Chauvin. Chauvin knelt on top of Floyd's neck for nine and a half minutes as he lay on a Minneapolis sidewalk in May 2020. George Floyd died after being stopped by Chauvin during a May 25, 2020 traffic stop in Minneapolis.

articles.title: Crypto mining pools, how they work, and their benefits
articles.summary: A mining pool is a network where multiple miners combine their computational resources to increase the chances of successfully mining cryptocurrency. Cryptocurrency mining is the process of validating and adding new transactions to a blockchain by solving complex cryptographic puzzles. Mining independently has become challenging due to higher computational requirements and network difficulty. Mining pools address these challenges by allowing individual miners to contribute their processing power to a shared network.
